HelpDescription:
I can provide an answer to most of your (Limbus-related) curiosities.
If you seek she who holds the answers, Faust is the name to remember.
...No, let me restate myself.
Not just most. **All** of them.
HelpItems: Sinner-related commands

Faust is here to help look for any query you might have, so learn to speak the language of Faust beforehand.
For further command help, see either `/limbus help identity`, `/limbus help ego`, or `/limbus help skills`
Other commands

Faust also has information on Refraction Railway stages.
`/limbus help rr`
As well as an E.G.O Gift Database for Mirror Dungeon.
`/limbus help gift`
Player-used status effects are available.
`/limbus help status`
HelpFooter: Changelog is available via /limbus help changelog

HelpDescription: Used for searching for Sinner Identities.
HelpItems: Basic Paramters

Filtering by a Sinner's Identities is straight-forward, via -s```i.e. -s yi sang```Filtering by an Identity's name is simple as well, and accepts partial names via -i```i.e. -i molar```Rarity can be filtered via -r```i.e. -r 3```Faust can further search by Identities with certain effect tags. For more information, see /limbus help effects.```-e, -effect, -effects```For those who care, Uptie 3 information is also available.```-t3```As an example for Spicebush Yi Sang:```/limbus identity -s yi sang -i spicebush```
Special Parameters

Using `-ego` while searching for an identity will tell you which identities can solo support that E.G.O. i.e. which identities can generate all the resources that E.G.O. requires.
It should go without saying, but this requires a sinner as well. There are 3 4th Match Flames, after all.
The Wacky Stuff

`-s1 -s2 -s3 -passive -support` will search for `-sin` (Sins), `-damage` (damage types) or `-e` (effects). Adding `-any` will search for ANY OF THE ABOVE in the selected skill slots.
An example:```identity -s faust -s1 -sin envy -damage pierce```Will give you FAUST identities that have ENVY AND PIERCE SKILL 1s.
HelpFooter: Due to how the identity query works, Faust will only show you the first TWELVE results.

HelpDescription: Used for searching for Sinner E.G.O
HelpItems: Basic Paramters

Filtering by a Sinner's E.G.O is straight-forward, via -s```i.e. -s faust```Filtering by an E.G.O's name is simple as well, and accepts partial names, via -ego```i.e. -ego hex nail```Rank can be filtered via -r```i.e. -r teth```Faust can further search by E.G.O with certain effect tags. For more information, see /limbus help effects.```-e, -effect, -effects```For those who care, Threadspin 3 information is also available.```-t3```As an example for Yi Sang's 4th Match Flame:```/limbus ego -s yi sang -ego 4th match flame```
Special Parameters

Using `-i, -identity` while searching for an E.G.O. will tell you which E.G.O can be solo supported by that identity, i.e. which E.G.O use only the resources that identity generates.
It should go without saying, but this requires a sinner as well. There are 3 4th Match Flames, after all.
The Wacky Stuff

`-awakening -corrosion -passive` will search for `-sin` (Sins) or `-damage` (damage types) or `-e` (effects. Adding `-any` will search for ANY OF THE ABOVE in the selected skill slots.
An example:```ego -s yi sang -awakening -sin sloth -e aoe```Will give you YI SANG AWAKENING EGO that are SLOTH AND HAVE AOE
Slightly Wackier Stuff

`-sort` will accept `maxpower, minpower, maxpotential, minpotential` as modifiers. You should be able to understand what they do.
Adding `-mod` will attempt to include additional coin modifiers, such as conditional coin power (Ryoshu's 4th Match Flame).
Unique to E.G.O, sorting by a sin (i.e. wrath, lust, envy) will sort by sin resists. Only one at a time though.
-cost, when given a list of sins separated by costs, will filter any found E.G.O that use only the sins provided.
HelpFooter: Due to how the E.G.O query works, Faust will only show you the first TWELVE results.

HelpDescription: Used for searching for Sinner ID Skills
HelpItems: Basic Paramters

Filtering skills by Sinners is straight-forward.```-s, -sinner```Filtering by an identity's skills is simple as well.```-i, -identity```Faust can further search skills with certain effect tags. For more information, see /limbus help effects.```-e, -effect, -effects```Adding `-long` will include the skill descriptions, but cuts down on the number of displayed skills, and some skills are simply too long to be displayed.
Faust has relented. Go compare the different W Corp Leaps, if you want.```-skill leap```
The Wacky Stuff

`-s1 -s2 -s3` will search for `-sin` (Sins), `-damage` (damage types) or `-e` (effects). Adding `-any` will search for ANY OF THE ABOVE in the selected skill slots.
An example:```skill -s1 -s2 -s3 -sin sloth -d blunt```Will give you SKILL 1s, 2s, and 3s that are SLOTH AND BLUNT
Slightly Wackier Stuff

`-sort` will accept `maxpower, minpower, maxpotential, minpotential` as modifiers.
'Power' in this case roughly refers to clash power while 'Potential' refers to the sum of rolls. (i.e. N Corp Sinlair's S3 has a maxpower of 30, and a maxpotential of 90)
Adding `-mod` will attempt to include additional coin modifiers, such as conditional coin power (W Corp Don's S3) or conditional coins (Kurokumo Hong Lu's S2).
HelpFooter: The skill query is particularly volatile, and the number of results is subject to change at any given time.

HelpDescription: Used for refining for Sinner ID Skills, E.G.O and E.G.O Gifts
HelpItems:
Faust has manually tagged every Identity, Skill, and E.G.O with the effects that they have, and it would likely be best to simply show you some examples.
For most positive effects, you may search for things such as `haste`, `ally heal sp`, and `party heal hp`
In this case, `ally` will be tagged with effects that target one or more allies, while `party` targets all the sinners on the field.
For most negative effects, you may search for things such as `attack power down` or `self tremor`
`charge` also comes with `charge support` for things such as AEDD Gregor's Spark Discharge, and effects such as `gaze` will be tagged with `pierce damage amp`
For consistency, please keep any effect queries to the actual effect's name, Faust will only deviate so far from glossary definitions.
For your benefit and curiosity, please see
```/limbus help tags```
to see more specifics.
HelpFooter: To hopefully add some ease of use, ID and E.G.O pages have their effect tags listed in the footer.

HelpItems:
```party heal hp, ally heal hp, heal hp```For effects that heal HP. Replace HP with SP for... that.
```charge support```Will be tagged on skills that have any capacity for giving allies charge, such as Charge Barrier, Spark Discharge, or directly giving charge.
```burn spread```Effects like Ishmael's Ardor Blossom Star, where attacking enemies with Burn afflicts random enemies with Burn.
```self tremor count, ally tremor count```For the IDs that use Tremor as a do-nothing counter. Ally Tremor is an example if we ever get anything like that.

HelpDescription:
Faust has information available on enemies in Refraction Railway and their resists, to assist with planning and teambuilding.```-line```Denotes which Railway line you're looking for. Accepts either the Line Number (i.e. 2) or its name (i.e. Mobius), or will default to the latest/most current Railway Line.```-stop```Is required, and denotes which Stop of the Railway you're looking up. Same thing, Stop Number (i.e. 1) or its name (i.e. curse) ((Partial names are accepted.))
As of Line 4, certain nodes are split between a .1 and a .2 wave due to discord limitations. Use the name.
For those who care, enemy names are spoiler tagged.

E.G.O Gifts and their available upgrades have been deemed a worthwhile addition, for those who need to reference such information.```-gift```Queries the gift name.```-e```Queries effects just like with IDs, Skills, and E.G.O.```-keyword```Searches for keywords.```-abno```Searches for the gift's source Abnormality. 'fusion' will work for fusion gifts in this context, and pack-specific gifts will accept their pack name as an Abnormality.
Faust is currently in development. If you're curious, here is what has changed recently.
HelpItems:
```MD5 Hard Gift Database has been updated
Bugfixes related to gift queries```

```The Manager of La Manchaland Don Quixote's Ascendant Sancho Hardblood Arts - La Sangre
was too much for the embed to handle
new override hot off the presses
    Thank you Don.```

```dontent
Several changes:
Units with alternate skills no longer have them in a second following embed.
    You can thank Don for that.
Previous changes means that Meursault's To Claim Their Bones is now acknowledged as a Defense Skill.
    You can thank Don for that.
Units with 'Always-active' Passives no longer have their descriptions when looking up an ID.
    You can thank Don for that.
The sheer number of E.G.O Gifts in MD5 Hard is astounding, and the amount of proofreading is giving me a headache.
Full Gift DB update is being put off until next week.
Some of the new fusion gifts required formatter overrides.
Actually useful: If you're just looking up an ID or E.G.O, you can drop the -i -s -ego whatever and Faust will do her best to figure out what you wanted.
limbus id la mancha don
    Thank you Don.```
